   "body_snippet": "## Expected Behavior\r\n<!--- If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen -->\r\n<!--- If you're suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work -->\r\nWhen the user clicked on a connection node (connections) that is already connected, the nRemoteNG could show up the connection Tab. I mean, could activate the \"Tab\" related to that connection.\r\n\r\nAnd also, the opposite should be expected behavior. For example:  when the user clicks (not double-click) on the connection TAB, the ap...",

+      "description": "Feature request to sync connection tree selection with active tab — clicking a tab should select the tree node, and clicking a connected tree node should activate the tab"

-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (claude): Feature request to sync connection tree selection with active tab — clicking a tab should select the tree node, and clicking a connected tree node should activate the tab\nApproach: In ConnectionWindow_GotFocus or a new tab-activated event handler, find the active tab's ConnectionInfo and set ConnectionTree.SelectedObject to that node. For the tree side, on single-click of an already-connected node, find its ConnectionWindow tab and activate it (DockContent.Activate). Add an option in Settings to enable/disable this sync behavior."
 }
